subject: Languages
title: Cherokee Syllabary: One Man's Genius
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Cherokee Syllabary: One Man's Genius.

hook.text: In the 1820s, a Cherokee man who couldn't read English created a writing system for his people in 12 years.

buildup.text: Sequoyah saw that European power came partly from literacy and decided Cherokee needed writing too.

discovery.text: He created 85 symbols, each representing one Cherokee syllable. The system was brilliantly simple.

twist.text: Cherokee literacy soared â€” within years, the Cherokee Nation had a newspaper and higher literacy than settlers.

climax.text: Sequoyah's syllabary is one of very few writing systems created by a single person in modern history.

punchline.text: One man gave his entire nation the power of writing â€” without ever learning to read.
